author: terra854
content:
Are there any plans to rearchitect the entire Ethereum software stack so that we will have one piece of software doing both execution and consensus tasks instead of having them split between 2 pieces of software

That way, we can have geth doing consensus or prysm able to execute smart contracts for an example.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think Erigon is working on something like that?  I'm not a fan personally, I think modularity and separation of concerns is valuable.  It also helps velocity to have well defined boundaries between parts of the system.

author: abcoathup
content: Erigon's embedded CL is called Caplin: https://erigon.substack.com/p/announcing-caplin-erigon-full-consensus
